body: WANT to bring a room of preservationists to a rolling boil? Just say two words: ''vinyl siding.'' In many communities you'll see plenty of nice old houses cloaked with vinyl, aluminum and asphalt coverings. It's just the kind of thing historic district regulations are designed to prevent, and even dedicated vinyl lovers in historic districts don't
title: Streetscapes/245 Fenimore Street in the Prospect Lefferts Gardens Historic District; Two Opposing Sides in the Debate Over Vinyl Siding

body: To the Editor: On April 2, the front-page article describing increasing property values in the five boroughs [''In All 5 Boroughs, High Goes Higher''] indicated that the highest increase in Brooklyn was in Bay Ridge, at 8 percent to 12 percent over the last year. This was based on ZIP code analysis, which can sometimes be misleading, especially in
title: Property Values And ZIP Codes

body: STYLE seekers, take a number. Beginning this month, dozens of budding decorators and amateur renovators throw open their homes, gardens, 18th-century estates, 19th-century row houses and contemporary apartments to visitors, as the show house season opens. Some show houses display the work of designers who are established, others the efforts of
title: Show Houses, From Farmhouse to Town House
